text: Wicker Chair is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Wicker Chair, add clues from the token bank to Wicker Chair up to its starting amount. Then, if you do not control any assets that take up at least 1 arcane slot: Lose 1 action.
back_flavor:
Unoccupied for the moment.
The stains might be tea or jam, or they might not be.

name: Wooden Stool
text: Wooden Stool is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Wooden Stool, add clues from the token bank to Wooden Stool up to its starting amount. X is equal to the highest number of ammo, supplies, charges, or secrets on an asset you control.
back_flavor:
Unoccupied for the moment.
The stains might be tea or jam, or they might not be.

flavor: Dreams within dreams, and none of them quite making sense.
name: The Dormouse
text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
[reaction] After you draw a non-weakness card from your deck, exhaust The Dormouse: Shuffle that card back into your deck and draw another card.

name: The Hare
text: The Hare cannot attack investigators at Center of the Table. Forced - After an investigator damages any other enemy, if The Hare is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hare is already at a connecting location, he attacks instead. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (3) to distract the Hare with a test of strength. If you succeed, automatically evade The Hare.

name: The Hare
text: Forced - After an investigator damages any other enemy, if The Hare is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hare is already at a connecting location, he engages and attacks instead.

name: The Hatter
text: The Hatter cannot attack investigators at Center of the Table. Forced - After an investigator discovers any number of clues, if The Hatter is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hatter is already at a connecting location, he attacks instead. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to distract the Hatter with a riddle. If you succeed, automatically evade The Hatter.

name: The Hatter
text: Forced - After an investigator discovers any number of clues, if The Hatter is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hatter is already at a connecting location, he engages and attacks instead.

name: Bizarre Brew
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - You guzzle down the mysterious drink. Test [combat] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and lose 2 resources. - You refuse to drink from the cup in front of you. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead.

name: Change Places!
text: Surge. Revelation - If you are at an untethered [[Chair]] location, swap your location with the furthest untethered [[Chair]] location from your location. All investigators and enemies at these locations are moved with the locations.

name: Clean Cup!
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Move each investigator and enemy that are in [[Chair]] locations once clockwise or counter-clockwise. All movement happens simultaneously and does not provoke attacks of opportunity. - You refuse to leave your seat. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead.

flavor: A cackling voice sounds from one of the chairs as another partygoer suddenly appears, sipping daintily from a tarry black cup.
name: Demented Guest
text: Forced - After Demented Guest enters a location: Place 1 doom on Demented Guest.

name: Mind Your Manners
text: Revelation - Put Mind Your Manners into your threat area. You cannot activate Parley effects. [free] Discard Mind Your Manners. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Mind Your Manners.

flavor: The wolfish guest eyes the places at the table next to him with genteel manners, but a feral look in his eye.
name: Obsessive Visitor
text:
Hunter.
X is equal to the number of clues on Obsessive Visitor's location and each connecting [[Chair]]  location (max 5).

flavor: The old man's headgear resembles a samovar, and he pours himself a cup of tea by bowing his head forward.
name: Teetotaler
text: If you "have terrible table manners," Teetotaler gains retaliate and alert.

flavor: "I told you butter wouldn't suit the works!"
name: Two Days Wrong
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). If you "have terrible table manners," this test gains peril and +2 difficulty. If you fail, take 1 horror and lose 1 action.

name: Bleeding Hearts
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X, X is half the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. -4 instead if The Queen of Hearts is at your location.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[elder_thing]: -2. -4 instead if The Executioner is in play.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X, X is the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[cultist]: -2. -4 instead if The Queen of Hearts is at your location or a connecting location.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[elder_thing]: -3. -5 instead if The Executioner is in play.

flavor: A case of stolen tarts. You'd laugh if it weren't being pinned on you with the death penalty waiting. The majority of the guards are still allowing you to move about the castle despite the accusations, so you'll have to do your best to not arouse the court's wrath any further.
name: Head Games
text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
back_flavor: "Haven't you found the culprit yet?! Off with his head!" The Queen's mood is worsening, and the executioner hurriedly sharpens his axe to comply with her wishes.
back_text: If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

flavor: The Queen stalks the castle grounds on the hunt for a victim. You're beginning to wonder just how much the Queen cares about the tarts, or if she just wants an excuse to execute someone.
name: Scapegoats
text: The Queen of Hearts gains alert. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
back_flavor: Another bellow from the Queen sends the executioner scrambling after you. You've given him the slip a few times already, but he's not about to lose his job over you, or his head for that matter.
back_text: If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

flavor: If this keeps up, the whole castle will soon be after your head. If you don't make these next few minutes count, then there won't be a chance to redeem yourself.
name: Eliminating Suspects
text: The Executioner and The Queen of Hearts gain alert. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.
back_flavor: The sheer number of card guards cut off every possible avenue of escape. Cornered against stone walls with your resources depleted, you stare grimly as the Queen and her executioner approach. "There can be no doubt! Off with their heads this instant!"
back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

flavor: The Queen of Hearts seems likely to decapitate everyone in sight if this theft isn't cleared up. First thing's first however, namely getting access to the crime scenes to clear your name. How easy that would be if you weren't the current primary suspect in all this.
name: Lip Service
text: Objective - If 1 [per_investigator] or more [[Restricted]] locations are revealed, you must advance.
back_flavor: You manage to ingratiate yourself with the queen's court enough for the guards to ease up on their restrictions. Now that you have access to the more closely-guarded parts of the castle, you can finally make some progress on tracking down the culprit. However, a greater problem has risen to light during your initial scouting of the castle. Shadowy creatures lurk in the darker recesses of the castle, and often found wherever crumbs of the tarts lie scattered. If Gurathnaka's minions are going to attack the castle, they certainly are biding their time.

flavor: While the queen's cronies have been quick about locking down the castle, they certainly haven't been thorough at their investigations. Between the missing tarts and the lurking threat of the shadows, finding the thief seems to be the key to both mysteries.
name: Trail of Tart-crumbs
text: Objective - Only investigators at Hedge Maze may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.
back_flavor: In a lonely branch of the hedge maze, you are finally able to locate the thief - the Knave of Hearts, as you might have expected. He sits on the grass with half a plate of tarts beside him and some red smudges at the corners of his mouth. Your approach startles the Knave, and he quickly stands to appraise you. "You are neither guard nor card. Good, you can assist in my plan. The tarts were a start, but the Queen must be driven into a greater fury." He leans in toward you to whisper, but keeps a bit of distance still. "I've seen shadowy creatures lurking in the darkest corners of the palace. You've seen them too, haven't you? I know what they can do to people, and I've no desire to follow suit. The trouble is, I can't get at them. Only intense emotions seem to draw them out out of hiding. The Queen's rage should be bait enough, but she must be in a state of rage like never before. I can vandalize the castle to provoke her, but I shall need your assistance."
back_text: Put the set-aside The Knave of Hearts into play at Hedge Maze.

flavor: The Knave may not be the most trustworthy person you've met, but the threat of Gurathnaka's shadows consuming the palace has forced your hand.
name: Anger Management
text: [action] If you are at The Knave of Hearts' location, spend 1 clue: Place 1 damage token on your location and move The Knave of Hearts to a connecting location. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Place 1 damage token on your location. [reaction] After The Queen of Hearts enters a location, if there is any amount of damage tokens on that location: Remove all damage tokens from that location and place an equal amount of horror on The Queen of Hearts. Objective - If there is 3 [per_investigator] or more horror on The Queen of Hearts, advance.
back_flavor: Your attempts at provoking the Queen's short temper reach immediate success. Between your direct interference and the Knave's expert sabotage of the castle, the Queen of Hearts has been pushed past her limit. "OFF WITH ALL OF YOUR HEADS!" she blasts, her face red as her own roses as she begins a tantrum. Shadows shift around the castle, reaching toward the queen in the midst of her meltdown.

flavor: Buckets and brushes lie abandoned by the white rose bushes. If the queen is as passionate about her roses as she was about her tarts, then you might be able to get in her good graces by doing a bit of impromptu gardening.
name: Rose Garden
text: [action] [action] You replant one of the white rose bushes with a red one: Remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. [action] If there is 0 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion: Resign. You flee before anyone else tries to condemn you.
back_flavor: The royal gardens bristle with bright red flowers of every variety, though you notice a small section of rose bushes that glisten and drip with a coating of red paint.

flavor: A small group of the queen's courtiers play croquet on the open terrace, albeit with flamingos and rolled-up hedgehogs instead of mallets and balls.
name: Croquet Grounds
text: [action]: You try to impress the courtiers to get them on your side. Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.
back_flavor: The sounds of laughter coming from the grounds mix with the squawks and squeaks of distressed animals. Just what sort of games are being played here?

flavor: Several members of the royal court amble about the maze, utterly lost but too proud to admit it. Perhaps you could gain their favor by helping them out of the labyrinth.
name: Hedge Maze
text: [action]: You try to give directions to one of the lost courtiers. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.
back_flavor: With how difficult Wonderland has been to navigate, you can only guess how much more frustrating a deliberate maze would be.

flavor: The eye of scrutiny is definitely strongest here. The members of the queen's court are all too eager to gain her favor by getting her angry at someone else.
name: Throne Room
text: Forced - After you discover any number of clues on Throne Room: Add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion or draw the top card of the encounter deck (choose one).
back_flavor: Heart motifs decorate every column, arch, and banner of the castle. Even the double doors leading to the royal audience chamber are heart-shaped.

flavor: The Queen's gardeners are awaiting execution forlornly, but patiently. If only there was something you could do for the poor doomed cards.
name: Dungeons
text: [reaction] After you evade or defeat The Executioner at this location: Place 1 resource on Dungeons (from the token bank) as a key. Forced - If there are 1 [per_investigator] or more keys on Dungeons: in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Compassion.
back_flavor: The castle dungeons are under strict lock and key, as you might expect. The sighs and groans of languishing prisoners fill the air.
back_text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Dungeons.

flavor: The jurors sit in their box with chalkboards in hand. Perhaps you can influence them before any trials get underway.
name: Courtroom
text: [action] If there are no clues on Courtroom: Remove up to 4 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion and place the same amount of clues on Courtroom (from the token bank).
back_flavor: With blame being constantly thrown your way, you don't relish the idea of being in a place that can make it official.
back_text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Courtroom.

flavor: The kitchens are a mess as the queen's servants ready the tarts. As they haven't cleaned up, there may be some evidence left from whoever stole the first set.
name: Kitchens
text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from Kitchens: Remove 2 blame from each investigator's copy of Royal Suspicion (group limit once per game).
back_flavor: The smell of freshly-baked tarts slips through the door to the royal kitchens. This new batch is being closely guarded, and anyone suspected of filching the first bunch is not allowed inside.
back_text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Kitchens.

flavor: Most of the card guards are out scouring the castle grounds for the culprit. The few that remain take offense at your intrusion here.
name: Guard Barracks
text: While you are investigating Guard Barracks, if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, Guard Barracks gains +2 shroud. Forced - When the investigator phase ends: Each investigator at Guard Barracks must discard 1 card from his or her hand at random.
back_flavor: The queen's card guards cross their spears as you approach, highly suspicious of anyone that she has accused of thievery.
back_text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Guard Barracks.

name: Royal Suspicion
text: Uses (3 blame). Forced - When any effect would add blame to Royal Suspicion: Place resources from the token bank on Royal Suspicion, as blame. Blame has no effect on its own, but other cards may reference the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion.

flavor:
If you need to get out of danger quickly,
the Knave might be around or he might not be.
name: The Knave of Hearts
text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] When you reveal a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt, exhaust The Knave of Hearts: Cancel that attack or evasion attempt.

flavor: He puts both the "judge" and "mental" into "judgmental."
name: The King of Hearts
text: [action]: Parley. Move up to 3 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion to a copy of Royal Suspicion controlled by another investigator. Any investigator at The King of Hearts's location may activate this ability. [action] Spend any amount of resources: Parley. For every 3 resources spent, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. Any investigator at The King of Hearts's location may activate this ability.

name: The Queen of Hearts
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with the most blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion. The Queen of Hearts cannot be damaged. If an investigator at The Queen of Hearts's location has 4 or more blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion, The Queen of Hearts loses aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Queen of Hearts is ready: Add 1 blame to each copy of Royal Suspicion controlled by an investigator at The Queen of Hearts's location. Forced - After you successfully attack The Queen of Hearts: she gets -3 evade for the rest of the phase. Add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.

name: The Executioner
text: Aloof. Hunter. Spawn - Guard Barracks or Dungeons. Prey - Investigator with the most blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion. If an investigator at The Executioner's location has 4 or more blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion, The Executioner loses aloof. Forced - After damage from The Executioner's attack defeats an investigator or ally: Place 1 doom on him.

name: Corrupt Noble
text: Forced - After Corrupt Noble attacks you: Lose 2 resources. If you cannot lose 2 resources, take 1 horror instead. [action]If you are engaged with Corrupt Noble: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, automatically evade The Queen of Hearts or The Executioner (choose one) and shuffle Corrupt Noble back into the encounter deck. If you fail, place 1 doom on Corrupt Noble.

name: Court Sycophant
text: Spawn - Any connecting location. Forced - When Court Sycophant spawns: Place 1 doom on Court Sycophant or add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion and discard Court Sycophant (choose one).

name: Damning Evidence
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion. - Add 4 blame to another investigator's copy of Royal Suspicion.

name: "Off With Their Heads!"
text: Revelation - If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter discard pile and deck for him and spawn him. If you have 4 or more blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, also place 1 doom on The Executioner.

name: Pointing Fingers
text: Peril. Revelation - Place 1 blame on any investigator's copy of Royal Suspicion. If that investigator's copy of Royal Suspicion has 4 or more blame on it, place 1 doom on the [[Card]] enemy closest to that investigator. That investigator tests [willpower] (X) where X is the amount of blame on his or her copy of Royal Suspicion. If he or she fails, he or she takes 1 horror and loses 1 action.

name: Wrong Place, Wrong Time
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage. If your copy of Royal Suspicion has 4 or more blame on it, take 1 horror.

flavor: Have a heart.
name: Executioner's Axe
text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [elder_thing] token is revealed during this attack, you may either treat that token's modifier as 0 or deal +1 additional damage (choose one).

name: Wild Snark Chase
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to half the doom on the current agenda (rounded up).
[cultist]: -4. If it is your turn, you may spend 1 action to make this token -2 instead.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail and your location has a horror on it, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -2. -4 instead if The Jabberwock is in play.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + half the doom on the current agenda (rounded up).
[cultist]: -5. If it is your turn, you may spend 1 action to make this token -3 instead.
[tablet]: -4. If your location has a horror on it, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -3. -5 instead if The Jabberwock is in play.

flavor: Despite the enthusiasm of the Bellman and his party, you have some reservations about searching through these woods in the dark. You get the unsettling feeling that as you search for the Snark, something far stranger and far stronger hunts for you.
name: Twas Brillig
text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
back_flavor: The Tulgey Wood reverberates with a horrible noise, an indescribable hissing, gurgling, roaring sound. You don't have to ask what sort of monster could make that noise as you see it hurtling through the woods toward you. It is an enormous loathsome thing with fiery eyes and razor-sharp claws that rend trees apart as it passes. Fear courses through your veins and you have scant seconds to decide whether to run or fight.
back_text: Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Jabberwockyencounter set into the encounter deck.

flavor: "It's the Jabberwock!" the Bellman cries, and rings his bell in wild alarm. The warning doesn't help you in the slightest however, as you are already in the throes of battle with it. The monster swoops and vanishes in its wild attacks, making you wonder just where and when it will strike next. You try to keep up the search while accounting for this added menace, but the Jabberwock's attack has drawn the attention of much darker beings.
name: A Manxome Foe
text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
back_flavor: The fiendish creature attacks with increasing frequency and fervor as you attempt to scour the Tulgey Wood. No matter where you turn, the Jabberwock's burning eyes and vicious claws are there to meet you. Even your best attacks leave you wondering if the beast can actually be killed at all.
back_text: Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. If The Jabberwock entered play from the victory display, place 2 [per_investigator] damage on it.

flavor: Even without accounting for the menace of the Jabberwock, the expedition's hopes are rapidly dwindling. The motley hunters cower in fear while the Bellman proudly declares that the Bodyguard will see them through yet. You have every intention of doing so, but the growing darkness and ravenous beasts of the wood may prove otherwise.
name: The Trail Grows Cold
text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.
back_flavor: As the Snark hunters grow more separated in their pursuit, the Bellman attempts to keep the group's morale in check. The bell clamors and clangs, but by now, all it can do is attract the attention of the many shadows drawn by the Jabberwock's attack.
back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

flavor: "Onward to the Snark!" the Bellman shouts as the hunters scatter into the Tulgey Wood. "Search high and low, for a Snark may lurk in any tree or hollow! Once we've gotten our bearings, it's as good as found!" You're not convinced it'll be that easy, or if the creature even resides in these woods at all, but some reconnaissance can't hurt.
name: Babes in the Woods
text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If there is no horror on your location, spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank). Objective - If there are six revealed [[Tulgey Wood]] locations, advance.
back_flavor: You and the other Snark hunters report your survey of the immediate area, but the Bellman is occupied with his own discovery. Near the tumtum tree, he stands above a small ditch where a discarded sword lies half-buried in mud. "Bodyguard!" he cries, looking for you, "it's sensible that the Bodyguard should manage all our weaponry for once we've found the Snark. Come collect this one! It should help us threaten the beast into submission!" You oblige the Bellman reluctantly, but are pleasantly surprised to find the weapon of surprisingly good quality and condition.
back_text: Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside The Vorpal Blade asset. For the remainder of the scenario, this asset does not take up any slots.

flavor: Despite the magnitude of the task and the inexperience of the other hunters, there seems to be some promise of success. All that remains now is to chase the trails wherever they may lead.
name: The Hunting of the Snark
text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If there is no horror on your location, spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank). Objective - When The Snark enters play, advance.
back_flavor: "Snark ahoy!" the Bellman hollers, "if it should prove no Boojum, then after it with haste!" You hurry toward the commotion and finally catch your first real glimpse of the Snark. Its appearance strikes you as being rather plain compared with the majority of Wonderland's other odd creatures. Could this really be the beast whose talents you need to escape these darkening woods alive?

flavor: "Now's our chance!" the Bellman bellows, "Seek it with thimbles, seek it with care! Pursue it with forks and hope! Threaten its life with a railway-share! Charm it with smiles and soap! Only vary your methods, or the Snark may grow suspicious!"
name: Catchall
text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If you are at The Snark's location: Parley. Test any skill (4). If you succeed, place a token on The Snark from the token pool according to the skill used: - If you used [willpower]: 1 horror. - If you used [intellect]: 1 clue. - If you used [combat]: 1 damage. - If you used [agility]: 1 resource. If you fail, move The Snark to a connecting location. Objective - If there are 2 [per_investigator] total tokens on The Snark, you must immediately advance.
back_flavor: You try every tactic you can to lure the Snark into capture. After minutes of half-hearted interest, the strange creature finally calms enough for you to approach and lay hands on it. "Masterfully snatched, Bodyguard!" the Bellman cheers, clanging his bell to gather the scattered expedition around.

flavor: The signs of a monstrous attack are etched into the lone tree.
name: Tumtum Tree
text: [action]: Search all play areas and out of play areas for The Jabberwock (including the victory display), ready it, and move it to Tumtum Tree. In your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Courage.
back_flavor: The perfect spot for resting and standing in thought. The Bellman rallies the Snark hunters from the tree, encouraging them with the loud clanging of his bell.

flavor: A number of different nests clump together under the sundial.
name: The Wabe
text: [action] If there are no horror and no clues on The Wabe: Place a horror token on The Wabe (from the token bank).
back_flavor: Inexplicably, the wood parts in a small clearing where a sundial sits in a circle of grass.

flavor: You'll have to repurpose several of your supplies to explore here.
name: Field of Chasms
text: [action] If there is no horror on Field of Chasms: Discard 1 [per_investigator] assets from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Field of Chasms (from the token bank).
back_flavor: The tall grass forms rings around rocky openings in the ground, each leading down several yards.

flavor: Scaling the top of the mound will take no little amount of skill.
name: Mound of Crags
text: [action] If there is no horror on Mound of Crags: Discard 1 [per_investigator] skills from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Mound of Crags (from the token bank).
back_flavor: A large hill rises out of the woods, covered on all faces by a network of stony outcroppings and ledges.

flavor: Fully exploring the valley will take quite a bit of maneuvering.
name: Narrow Valley
text: [action] If there is no horror on Narrow Valley: Discard 1 [per_investigator] events from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Narrow Valley (from the token bank).
back_flavor: This part of the wood sinks in a deep crevasse, scarcely big enough for a single person to walk down the center of.

flavor: Your attention is finally drawn to the Baker, who shouts without restraint and waves his arms wildly. "It's a Snark! Callooh! Callay! Our quarry is finally in sight!" The Baker's confirmation sounds too good to be true. Seeing as you've scoured the rest of the Tulgey Wood, however, if a Snark can be found here at all, then the Baker's proclamation might be believed.
name: The Baker's Trail
text: Forced - If there is exactly 1 location without horror on it: Flip this card and put it into play.

name: The Snark
text: Aloof. Spawn - Location without horror on it. The Snark cannot be engaged, damaged, or defeated.

flavor: "The Snark has cut and run," the Butcher declares, "We've sent it packing, and so it must have returned to its pack." You don't recall anything about Snarks being social creatures, but you are drawn to a nearby grove by a jumble of strange sounds.
name: The Butcher's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Butcher's detour passes by a hollow tree occupied by a variety of agitated creatures.
name: Lonely Backwoods
text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

flavor: "I tailed the Snark, but mine fell flat," the Beaver grumbles, holding its flat tail, "Its own tail must be frought with danger." The woods are already filled with danger, but at the Beaver's insistence, you proceed toward a shadowy and isolated valley.
name: The Beaver's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Beaver's directions lead to a particularly dark and dismal chasm.
name: Lonely Backwoods
text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 treachery that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

flavor: "The Snark resists all attempts at bribery," the Banker muses, "and therefore must be found at the bank of a river." You doubt the connection, but the watery footprints you find along the river are proof enough to continue the chase here
name: The Banker's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Banker's pursuit ends at the banks of a dangerous series of river rapids.
name: Lonely Backwoods
text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Spend a total of 3 [per_investigator] resources from among all investigators' resource pools at this location. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

flavor: "The Snark must be somewhere deep and lonely," the Barrister speculates, "Or it would have answered the summons I sent it." You're not certain of the Snark's ability to read at all, but the strange noises emanating from a nearby cavern give reason enough to search it.
name: The Barrister's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Barrister's course winds through a claustrophobic series of tunnels.
name: Lonely Backwoods
text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search your deck and discard pile for a weakness and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

flavor: "We must search both high and low," the Broker declares, "but let us start low for the sake of our stock." Though the premise is flawed, this still leads you toward soft mud and bent plants that betray the passage of some creature very recently.
name: The Broker's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Broker's track treads over marshy ground that severely limits your options.
name: Rough Hinterlands
text: [action] If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Discard cards with total cost of 3 [per_investigator] from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

flavor: "It's taken our cue," the Billiard-Maker bemoans, dusting off his hands, "and so it will want chalk to dust the tip, from somewhere rocky, I presume." His theory seems far-fetched at best, but you can't deny the trail of white powder leading down the rocks.
name: The Billiard-Maker's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Billiard-Maker's chase requires you to bridge a vast canyon by whatever means you can.
name: Rough Hinterlands
text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test any skill (3). This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

flavor: "No arrangement could be made to satisfy the beast!" the Bonnet-Maker despairs, "If it refuses a bonnet, then it must be indoors!" You hold your tongue at the notion, but the echoes of some strange beast from a secluded cave cause you to reconsider.
name: The Bonnet-Maker's Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Bonnet-Maker's path leads to the entrance of a deep and eerie cave.
name: Rough Hinterlands
text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

flavor: "We've bared our soles in this chase," the Boots grumbles, staring at a hole in his shoe, "And yet the Snark hasn't worn out its own shoes. It must be climbing instead." The assumption doesn't seem quite right to you, though you spot movement atop a nearby cliff.
name: The Boots' Trail
text: Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

flavor: The Boots' route directs you to a small ledge atop a sheer cliff face.
name: Rough Hinterlands
text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

flavor: With the confidence he carries, one might assume that he knows what he's doing.
name: The Bellman
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to lose any amount of resources, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 damage to him: You ignore that part of the effect.
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to discard any amount of cards from your hand, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 horror to him: You ignore that part of the effect.

flavor: You've never seen something so frumious before.
name: Bandersnatch
text: Hunter. Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. If Bandersnatch moved during the enemy phase, it does not attack. Forced - When an investigator enters Bandersnatch's location: It readies, engages, and attacks that investigator.

flavor: This one looks particularly mimsy.
name: Borogrove
text: Surge. Hunter. Aloof. Forced - When any amount of damage would be dealt to another enemy at Borogrove's location: Deal that damage to Borogrove instead.

name: Going in Circles
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Remove a horror from any location, then add 1 [per_investigator] clues on it from the token bank.

flavor: Desperate and in perpetual passion.
name: Jubjub Bird
text: Hunter. Aloof. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Jubjub Bird is ready and unengaged: It attacks each investigator at its location in player order.

name: Looking-Glass Swarm
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, put Looking-Glass Swarm into play in your threat area. Your attacks cannot deal more than 1 damage. You cannot discover more than 1 clue while investigating. [action] [action]: Discard Looking-Glass Swarm.

flavor: The only creature that could outgribe this loudly.
name: Mome Rath
text:
Retaliate.
If there is a horror on Mome Rath's location, it gets +2 fight and +1 horror.

flavor: Gyring and gimbling away.
name: Slithy Tove
text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Slithy Tove is successfuly evaded: Move it to a connecting location and ready it.

flavor: 'One, two! One, two! And through and through!'
name: Vorpal Blade
text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [elder_sign], [bless], +1, or 0 token is revealed during this attack, you may either heal 1 horror or deal an additional +1 damage (choose one, if your target has the [[Monster]], [[Abomination]], or [[Shadow]] traits, you may choose both instead).

name: The Jabberwock
text: The Jabberwock gets +1 damage and +1 horror during the enemy phase. Forced - At the end of the round, disengage The Jabberwock from all investigators and move it and all tokens on it next to the agenda deck, out of play.

name: Claws That Catch
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if The Jabberwock is in play. If you fail, take 1 damage and lose 2 resources.

name: Eyes of Flame
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if The Jabberwock is in play. If you fail, take 1 horror and discard 2 cards from your hand at random.

name: Whiffling Through the Wood
text: Revelation - If The Jabberwock is in the victory display, Whiffling Through the Wood gains surge. Otherwise, if the Jabberwock is out of play, put it into play at your location. If the Jabberwock is already in play, deal 1 damage and 1 horror to all investigators at its location, then move it to your location.

name: Sibling Rivalry
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1. -3 instead if there are at least 1 [per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card.
[cultist] [tablet]: -2. -4 instead if there are not an equal number of damage and horror tokens on the scenario card.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 damage token and 1 horror token on the scenario card.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2. -4 instead if there are at least 1 [per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card.
[cultist] [tablet]: -3. -5 instead if there are not an equal number of damage and horror tokens on the scenario card.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, place 1 damage token and 1 horror token on the scenario card.

flavor: Acting on the Tweedles' orders, the cards and chess pieces clash with each other on every available point in the small wooded valley. At the rate this battle is escalating, the soldiers might actually kill one of the Tweedles before you can get the rattle.
name: Brother Against Brother
text: Forced - When a [[Card]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 damage token on the scenario card (from the token bank). Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 horror token on the scenario card (from the token bank).
back_flavor: With the slight shifting of the flow of combat, one of the soldiers gets an opportunity to storm the opposing hill and attack the dismayed twin on it.
back_text:
Count the damage and horror tokens on the scenario card and resolve the following:
- If there are more damage tokens on the scenario card than horror tokens and Tweedledum is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledum.
- If there are more horror tokens on the scenario card than damage tokens and Tweedledee is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledee.
- Otherwise: Deal 1 damage to either Tweedledum or Tweedledee (choose one in play).
If no resolution was reached through this effect, remove all tokens from the scenario card. Then, flip this agenda back to its 'a' side.

flavor: To end the pointless war between Tweedledum and Tweedledee and get that rattle, you're going to have to be creative, especially if you don't want to just kill one of them. Unfortunately, the massive amounts of cards and chess pieces recruited by the Tweedles are bogging down any plans you've devised.
name: Thinning the Ranks
text: Objective - If there are no enemies in play, advance.
back_flavor: The twins' armies are almost as evenly matched as they themselves are. Every soldier of theirs that you cut down swings the balance of the battle in the favor of the other. However, with fewer soldiers blocking your movements, you can focus on figuring out how to bring an end to the battle.

flavor: As the battle drags on, the shadows initially banished by the rattle have begun to creep back toward the valley. You think on the childish personalities of the Tweedles and their old nursery rhyme, and you wonder if you can somehow focus the shadows to scare them out of their duel.
name: Scare Tactics
text: Objective - Only investigators at Overgrown Dell may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.
back_flavor: At first it seems to be impossible to corral the shadows toward any specific part of the battlefield. However, on the sloped terrain around the battlefield, you find several fallen crow feathers that seem to draw nearby shadows toward them. You gather as many as you can find and collect them in the central valley. Within minutes, darkness begins to coalesce around the bundle of feathers and expand into an enormous shape. You take several steps back and cover your ears as the unearthly cawing of an unnatural crow screams out from the growing darkness. Tweedledum and Tweedledee stop barking orders at their minions and stand in frightened awe as the shadowy crow takes shape.
back_text: Put the set-aside Monstrous Crow into play next to the agenda deck.

flavor: The Tweedles are already panicking, but still attempting to marshal their troops into action. With the shadowy crow bearing down on the battlefield, you have the tool you need to scare some sense into the twins.
name: As the Crow Flies
text: [action] If you are at the same location as Tweedledum or Tweedledee: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 horror on an uncontrolled story asset at your location. Objective - If Tweedledum (Terrified Twin)and Tweedledee (Terrified Twin) are both in the victory display, advance.
back_flavor: The Tweedles' nerves were failing them at the crow's appearance, but your added fearmongering sends them screaming and scrambling away from the battle. Without their leaders, the cards and chess pieces have no further driving force, and amble away from the valley harmlessly. Satisfied, you grab the last discarded piece of the rattle and turn your attention up to the shadowy crow.

flavor: The card and chess soldiers clash around you, obeying the orders of the twins. If only you could convince them to give up this ridiculous duel.
name: Overgrown Dell
text: [action] If there are at least 2 [per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Reason.
back_flavor: Fallen logs and tangling weeds collect at the bottom of this small valley. This doesn't seem to deter the cards and chess pieces marching down from the opposing hills.

flavor: The bulk of Tweedledum's forces waits here for an opportunity to get into the fray.
name: West Hill
text: [action] Parley: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to convince one of Tweedledum's playing cards to abandon the fight. If you succeed, place 1 damage token on the scenario card. If you fail, take 1 damage instead.
back_flavor: Tweedledum stands atop this hill, looking angrily out across the valley toward his brother with his arms folded.

flavor: The bulk of Tweedledee's forces waits here for an opportunity to get into the fray.
name: East Hill
text: [action] Parley: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to convince one of Tweedledee's chess pieces to abandon the fight. If you succeed, place 1 horror token on the scenario card. If you fail, take 1 horror instead.
back_flavor: Tweedledee stands atop this hill, sulking with his fists on his hips in a show of discontentment.

flavor: The cards raise their spears as you approach, guarding the ascent to the hill carefully.
name: Northwest Slope
text: If there are at least 2 more damage tokens than horror tokens on the scenario card, you cannot investigate Northwest Slope.
back_flavor: The path up the north side of Tweedledum's hill is packed with cards all clamoring to get down into the central valley. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The card guards form into orderly ranks to prepare for their march down the slopes.
name: Northwest Slope
text: Forced - At the end of the round, heal 1 damage from each [[Card]] enemy at Northwest Slope.
back_flavor: The path up the north side of Tweedledum's hill is packed with cards all clamoring to get down into the central valley. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The chess pieces group together as you approach, carefully gauging your loyalty in this fight.
name: Northeast Slope
text: If there are at least 2 more horror tokens than damage tokens on the scenario card, you cannot investigate Northeast Slope.
back_flavor: The path up the north side of Tweedledee's hill is swarming with chess pieces determined to join battle. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The horde of chess pieces rally here for their assault on the central valley.
name: Northeast Slope
text: Forced - At the end of the round, heal 1 damage from each [[Chess]] enemy at Northeast Slope.
back_flavor: The path up the north side of Tweedledee's hill is swarming with chess pieces determined to join battle. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The chess pieces mustered here seem particularly tense. It might be easy getting them to panic.
name: Southwest Slope
text: [reaction] After a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated at Southwest Slope: This location gets -3 shroud until the end of the round (group limit once per round).
back_flavor: The path up the south side of Tweedledum's hill is overflowing with cards rushing down to the valley. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The cards here bolster their forces to make up for any shortcomings on other parts of the battlefield.
name: Southwest Slope
text: While there are more damage tokens on the scenario card than horror tokens, Southwest Slope gets +2 shroud.
back_flavor: The path up the south side of Tweedledum's hill is overflowing with cards rushing down to the valley. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The cards assaulting this slope aren't very cohesive. It might be easier than you expected to drop their guard.
name: Southeast Slope
text: [reaction] After a [[Card]] enemy is defeated at Southeast Slope: This location gets -3 shroud until the end of the round (group limit once per round).
back_flavor: The path up the south side of Tweedledee's hill is practically bursting with chess pieces, all eager to fight. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

flavor: The chess pieces here have a more fortified position to balance any losses suffered across the valley.
name: Southeast Slope
text: While there are more horror tokens on the scenario card than damage tokens, Southeast Slope gets +2 shroud.
back_flavor: The path up the south side of Tweedledee's hill is practically bursting with chess pieces, all eager to fight. You may not be able to get back down the way you came.

name: Tweedledum
text: [action]: Deal 3 damage to Tweedledum. Any investigator at Tweedledum's location may activate this ability. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - If there is 1 [per_investigator] horror on Tweedledum: Flip Tweedledum and move him to the victory display. Forced - If Tweedledum is defeated by damage: (→R2).

flavor: Just then flew down a monstrous crow, As black as a tar-barrel! Which frightened both the heroes so, They quite forgot their quarrel.
name: Tweedledum
Tweedledee
text: [action]: Deal 3 damage to Tweedledee. Any investigator at Tweedledee's location may activate this ability. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - If there is 1 [per_investigator] horror on Tweedledee: Flip Tweedledee and move him to the victory display. Forced - If Tweedledee is defeated by damage: (→R2).

flavor: Just then flew down a monstrous crow, As black as a tar-barrel! Which frightened both the heroes so, They quite forgot their quarrel.
name: Tweedledee
Monstrous Crow
text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, Monstrous Crow attacks each investigator in player order, regardless of location. Investigators as a group may spend 1 clue to cancel an attack made against any investigator.

name: Caught in the Fray
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] or [agility] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. For each [[Card]] enemy discarded, take 1 damage and lose 1 resource. For each [[Chess]] enemy discarded, take 1 horror and discard a card from your hand at random.

name: Contested Area
text: Revelation - Attach Contested Area to your location. Forced - When an enemy would spawn at or enter the attached location: Place 1 doom on that enemy. [action]: Test [intellect] or [combat] (4). If you succeed, discard Contested Area.

flavor: The shadows are getting tired of lurking.
name: Dark Interference
text: Peril. Revelation - Search the encounter deck for a [[Soldier]] enemy. You must either (choose one): - Spawn that enemy at a [[Slope]] location (empty if possible) with 1 doom on it. - Discard that enemy, then take 1 damage and 1 horror. After resolving this effect, shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Gaining Ground
text: Revelation - Resolve whichever is true: - If there is more damage on Tweedledum than on Tweedledee: Place 1 damage on the scenario card, then take 1 damage. - If there is more damage on Tweedledee than on Tweedledum: Place 1 horror on the scenario card, then take 1 horror. - If there is an equal amount of damage on both Tweedledum and Tweedledee: Place 1 damage and 1 horror on the scenario card, then take 1 damage and 1 horror.

name: Priority Target
text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no [[Soldier]] enemies in play, Priority Target gains surge. Otherwise, attach Priority Target to a [[Soldier]] enemy in play. The attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +2 health, and gains the [[Elite]] trait.

flavor: As good as new.
name: Tweedles' Rattle
text: [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Investigate. Ignore all effects that increase your location's shroud for this test. [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Evade. If your target has the [[Monster]], [[Abomination]], or [[Shadow]] traits, you get +2 [agility] for this test.

name: Fool's Mate
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Chess]] enemies in play (max -5).
[cultist] [tablet]: -2. If this token is revealed during a fight or evade attempt against a [[Chess]] enemy, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -1. -3 instead if you are at a [[Shadow]]  location.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Chess]] enemies in play.
[cultist] [tablet]: -3. If this token is revealed during a fight or evade attempt against a [[Chess]] enemy, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -2. -4 instead if you are at a [[Shadow]]  location.

flavor: Your arrival on the front lines spurs movement from the far side of the board. If any truce was maintained until now, the time for it has passed.
name: Opening Strategy
text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
back_flavor: Your preparations to cross the center line have been carefully observed. The red pieces storm out from the darkened castle. You have noticed from the first attackers that the pieces still somehow obey what you would consider normal chess rules. Is the Red King still guiding their movements? Or is it such a core part of the pieces that they move instinctively?
back_text: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a King's Shadow and spawn it at the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

flavor: The battle on the chess fields continues with increasing fervor. Red pieces flow out from the darkened half of the board with surprising speed to meet your approach.
name: Countergambit
text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
back_flavor: The red pieces pause their fighting to bow and kneel as an imposing figure emerges from the shadowy veil. The Red Queen, her face somehow both hard and soft at once, gazes hatefully across the fields at you as power swells within her. Shadows pour from her robes, and she begins to mutate further. "Strike down the invaders!" she bellows, racing toward you with tremendous speed.
back_text: If the Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

flavor: As the Red Queen advances upon you, the shadows spread with the speed of a wildfire toward the white castle. Darkness begins to claw at the sky, and each piece of landscape appears like a blackened copy of itself.
name: File Occupation
text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.
back_flavor: The red army relentlessly presses back against your charge in a seemingly unending flow of soldiers. As they push back, the amassed shadows sweep past you towards the castle of the white chess pieces and crash against it like a tidal wave. Your fighting for conquest turns to a fight for survival as you flee the battlefield.
back_text: Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned takes 1 physical trauma from fighting off the red army. (→R1)

flavor: You can barely make out the silhouette of the Red King's castle amid the darkened clouds ahead of you. It will be quite an ordeal to make it across the ruined half of the chess board fields.
name: Across the Board
text: [action]: Move an unengaged [[Chess]] enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide. Objective - When an investigator enters the Eighth Row, advance.
back_flavor: Through the swirling darkness, you charge up the steps of the red castle and burst through the towering double doors. The Red King sits at the opposite end of a grand hall, seated languidly in a grand skeletal throne. He does not make any motion as you enter, though the shadows leaking out of his hooded cloak begin to pour with increasing volume.
back_text: Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators went through the looking-glass,spawn the set-aside The Red King (Obscure Overlord)at Eighth Row. Otherwise, spawn the set-aside The Red King (Tenebrous Tyrant)at Eighth Row. If the Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

flavor: The Red King utters no commands or cries of alarm, but his minions pursue you into the castle as the shadows try to blot the light out behind you. Your only recourse is triumph, here and now.
name: Absolute Pin
text: [action]: Move an unengaged [[Chess]] enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide. Objective - If The Red King is defeated, advance.
back_flavor: You strike the Red King with every bit of courage you can muster, and all at once, the red pieces freeze and the shadows' advance halts. The entire area seems suspended in time for a moment before the king slips down out of his throne and splays on the floor before you.

flavor: The White King does his best to rally his pieces into action, but they largely ignore him.
name: First Row
text: [action]: Resign. "This is a losing game." [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror (limit once per game).
back_flavor: The majority of the white chess pieces cluster inside the white castle, hesitant but clearly worried as they gaze down towards the shadowy far side of the board.

flavor: The outer walls of the white chess pieces offer some protection against the attacking red pieces.
name: Second Row
text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move the evaded enemy to either the Third Row or the Fourth Row.
back_flavor: The white chess pieces' fortifications end at this square. Beyond lies an open battlefield.

flavor: The third row is open and spacious, with many well-kept roads running through it.
name: Third Row
text: [reaction] After you move to this location as your first action: Move to a connecting location.
back_flavor: The wide fields are perfectly square, though dense hedge rows block your path to any other column of this chess board.

flavor: A white knight roams near the border of the fifth row, muttering to himself in confusion.
name: Fourth Row
text: Forced - After you reveal Fourth Row: Put the set-aside The White Knight into play at this location and shuffle both set-aside copies of Absent-Minded into the encounter deck. [free] Discard the top card of your deck: Shuffle any other card from your discard pile back into your deck (limit once per round).
back_flavor: The sun shines down in scattered rays as the darkness from the far half of the board begins reaching across.

flavor: Your body seems to fight you with each step forward, as if your own shadow were pulling back on you.
name: Fifth Row
text: Forced - After you reveal Fifth Row: Reveal the top five cards of your deck and draw each weakness revealed. Shuffle your deck.
back_flavor: A deep split in the field separates the fourth and fifth rows. Shadows churn at the bottom, making it uncertain just how deep it is.
back_text: As an additional cost to enter Fifth Row, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group.

flavor: Shadows coil in from the sides of the square, as if trying to hedge you in.
name: Sixth Row
text: Forced - After you enter Sixth Row: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, immediately end your turn.
back_flavor: The terrain grows rougher with each step you take into enemy territory.
back_text: As an additional cost to enter Sixth Row, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group.

flavor: You find it hard to keep your footing as you make your way across the dim landscape and through the broken defenses of the red chess pieces.
name: Seventh Row
text: Forced - When you reveal Seventh Row: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Chess]] enemy and spawn it engaged with an investigator at this location. If you searched the encounter deck, shuffle it.
back_flavor: The outer fortifications of the red chess pieces lie crumbling, though the many corrupted pieces still lurk within them.
back_text: As an additional cost to enter Seventh Row, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group.

flavor: The castle of the red king lies in ruins at the edge of a massive cloudy void, torn apart unevenly by hungry claws.
name: Eighth Row
text: Forced - While there are 1 [per_investigator] or fewer clues at this location, as an additional cost to investigate this location: Choose and discard a card from your hand.
back_flavor: A roiling blanket of darkness veils the final square almost completely.
back_text: As an additional cost to enter Eighth Row, investigators must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group.

flavor: The Cheshire Cat might be offended if you mention curiosity killing anything.
name: Distant Square
text: Revelation - In your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Curiosity. Investigators cannot enter Distant Square. [free] If The White Knight is on Distant Square, deal 1 horror to him: Ready The White Knight and move him to any revealed location. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.
back_flavor: You can spot chess pieces moving to this square out of the corner of your eye, but it seems a world away.
back_text:
Investigators cannot enter Distant Square.
[action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Reveal Distant Square. Investigators as a group may activate this ability from any location.

name: The White King
text:
[reaction] After you take the draw action, exhaust The White King: Draw 1 additional card. Any investigator at The White King's location may activate this ability.
[reaction] After you take the resource action, exhaust The White King: Gain 2 additional resources. Any investigator at The White King's location may activate this ability.

name: The Red King
text: Alert. The Red King cannot make attacks of opportunity during investigate actions. While there are more than 1 [per_investigator] clues on Eighth Row, The Red King gets +2 fight and retaliate. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues from Eighth Row: Deal X damage to The Red King where X is the amount of clues he or she discovered.

name: The Red King
text: Alert. The Red King cannot make attacks of opportunity during investigate actions. While there are more than 1 [per_investigator] clues on Eighth Row, The Red King gets +2 fight and retaliate. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues from Eighth Row: Deal X damage to The Red King where X is the amount of clues he or she discovered.

flavor: "…all she remembers is, that they were running hand in hand, and the Queen went so fast that it was all she could do to keep up with her: and still the Queen kept crying `Faster! Faster!"
name: The Red Queen
text: Prey - Lowest [agility]. While you are engaged with The Red Queen, you cannot activate [free] effects or play cards with the fast keyword.

name: Discovered Attack
text: Revelation - Put Discovered Attack into play in your threat area. Forced - After you enter an enemy's location or an enemy enters your location: Place 1 doom on that enemy. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, discard Discovered Attack.

name: King's Shadow
text: Aloof. Hunter. King's Shadow cannot be engaged. Forced - When you would leave King's Shadow's location: King's Shadow attacks you. [reaction] After you successfully investigate or discover clues from your location: Deal 1 damage to King's Shadow.

name: Overextended
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if you are at a [[Shadow]] location. If you fail, take 1 damage (2 damage instead if there is a [[Chess]] enemy at your location). If you failed by 2 or more, lose 2 resources.

name: Promotion
text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no [[Chess Soldier]] enemies in play, Promotion gains surge. Otherwise, choose a [[Chess Soldier]] enemy and attach Promotion to it. The attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, and +1 horror. If the attached enemy is a Pawn, it gets an additional +1 fight, +2 health, and +1 evade.

name: Zugzwang
text: Revelation - Attach Zugzwang to your location. Forced - When you would leave attached location, you must (choose two different options): - Take 1 damage. - Take 1 horror. - Discard 1 card from hand at random. - Lose 1 resource. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Zugzwang.

name: The White Knight
text: Investigators at The White Knight's location get +1 to all skills when resolving effects or during attack, evasion, or investigate attempts on or against [[Chess]] cards. [action] Parley: Move The White Knight to a connecting location. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if The White Knight is ready and at Distant Square: Move him to any investigator's location.

flavor: "There he goes! Right on his head as usual!"
name: Absent Minded
text: Surge. Revelation - Exhaust The White Knight and move him to Distant Square.

name: Lucid Nightmare
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. -4 instead if there is more total damage and horror on Alice than on your investigator.
[cultist]: -2. -4 instead if you are at a [[Wonderland]] or [[Shadow]] location.
[tablet]: -2. -4 instead if there are 3 or fewer [[Wonderland]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -2. If Gurathnaka is at your location, reveal another token.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. -5 instead if there is more total damage and horror on Alice than on your investigator.
[cultist]: -3. -5 instead if you are at a [[Wonderland]] or [[Shadow]] location.
[tablet]: -3. -5 instead if there are 3 or fewer [[Wonderland]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -3. If Gurathnaka is at your location, reveal another token.

flavor: The stability of Arkham continues to degrade as it had when you first entered Wonderland. Darkness spreads from the north half of the city, and with it, Gurathnaka and its minions. Shadows greedily consume everything in their path like a forest fire, gorging and growing steadily stronger.
name: Burgeoning Darkness
text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).
back_flavor: Alice leans against a partially demolished building as another ungodly roar rips through the air. Her efforts are slowing the shadows from crossing over into Arkham, but her body and spirit are being quickly overtaxed.
back_text: Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (→R2).

flavor: Gurathnaka leads its shadows in consuming any and all material they can claw apart; animal, vegetable, or mineral. A dark void radiates out in their wake, emptier even than the void of space.
name: Mass Consumption
text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).
back_flavor: Reality wavers and ripples inconstantly, unbalancing you in its shifting state. You rise quickly, but Alice takes several more moments to push herself unsteadily back up. If the shadows grow in strength much further, then Alice may not survive the strain.
back_text: Deal 2 damage and/or horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (→R2).

flavor: The fading glow of twilight and the few remaining street lights in Arkham light your way as you hurry as never before. When darkness overtakes the city, it will be the end not only for you, but all life on Earth.
name: Last Light
text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).
back_flavor: The sharp popping and shattering of glass sounds over the rumble of the crumbling landscape. With all now artificial light gone, you can only watch in despair as the fading glow of twilight darkens to night and the shadows claw at you from all sides.
back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

flavor: Shards and echoes of Wonderland pervade the familiar districts of Arkham. The only way you will be able to banish the shadows is to purge the parts of the city overlapping with Alice's dreams. It is finally time for you to leverage what you learned in your journey.
name: Separating Fantasy
text: Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: The investigators as a group must choose and play one card from Alice's hand. Then, you may move Alice to any connecting location. [reaction] After you successfully attack Gurathnaka: Discover a clue at your location. Objective - If there are no [[Wonderland]] locations in play, you must immediately advance.
back_flavor: With Alice attempting to repel her own dreams from the real world, you focus on your memories of the people and places of Arkham. Each routine sound, unique scent, and memorable hallmark of the city that you can recall helps to separate the two worlds and redefine the boundaries. As you peel away Wonderland from Arkham, the impossible jumble that you left behind in the Northside and Downtown districts begins to rearrange. The overwhelming darkness begins to concentrate at the spot where Alice's house once appeared, each shadow being drawn inevitably toward it. Gurathnaka stutters, as if attempting to exist in multiple realities at once, bellowing with abominable fury as it too is drawn toward the growing void.
back_text: Put the set-aside Northside, Downtown, Easttown, and Vacuous Void locations into play. Move each investigator and weakness enemy to Easttown. Flip Gurathnaka and move it to Vacuous Void. Discard all other enemies and remove each other location from the game.

flavor: Though the void draws the shadows and last vestiges of Alice's dream, Gurathnaka resists its pull, its continued howls reverberating in your bones. Its indescribable voice speaks to a primal fear within you, but the only way to survive this nightmare is to banish the Eater of Dreams.
name: Darkest Before Dawn
text: Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: The investigators as a group must choose and play one card from Alice's hand. Then, you may move Alice to any connecting location. [reaction] When you would discover any amount of clues, even if your location has no clues on it: You may place that many of your clues on Gurathnaka instead. Objective - If there are more clues on Gurathnaka than it has remaining health, advance.
back_flavor: Amid the rushing vacuum of the darkness through the wavering fissure, Gurathnaka claws at Arkham greedily. Each time you repel the monster, drawing from your recent experiences to weaken its grip through the dimensions. Alice focuses every fiber of her will on maintaining stability while you unravel the portal and sever Gurathnaka's attachment to Arkham. Weary minutes pass, until finally, a breakthrough! The shadowy abomination falls through the endless void, still reaching toward you with empty hunger. "It's through!" Alice cries, though you cannot make a reply before the rift sutures itself shut, and a ripple bursts forth from the point of exit, knocking you off your feet.

flavor: The streets of the Merchant District blend with the features of the steep valley where the Tweedles met in their earlier battle.
name: Merchant District
text: [action]: Investigate. Double Merchant District's shroud for this test. If you succeed, discover an additional clue. If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random and lose a resource (limit one success per turn). Forced - If there are no clues on Merchant District: Flip it.

flavor: The Merchant District returns to its lonely state, no less abandoned at night for all the chaos around it.
name: Merchant District

flavor: The Miskatonic river carries a salt air, and the waves wash over the riverbank as if it were Wonderland's Sea of Tears.
name: Rivertown
text: [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, Rivertown gets -3 shroud until the end of the phase. If you fail, take 1 damage (limit 1 success per round). Forced - If there are no clues on Rivertown: Flip it.

flavor: The waters of the Miskatonic have receded, though the surface still churns with each ripple of reality.
name: Rivertown

flavor: Miskatonic's campus is segmented and alternates between colored sections in a pattern like the chess field of Wonderland.
name: Miskatonic University
text: [action]: Investigate. When you initiate this test, discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, you get +X [intellect] for this test, where X is the cost of the discarded card. Forced - If there are no clues on Miskatonic University: Flip it.

flavor: The university's ivy halls have returned and reordered, but the invasive darkness still pervades the campus grounds.
name: Miskatonic University

flavor: The stately architecture of French Hill overlaps with ornate stonework that you recognize from the Queen of Hearts' castle.
name: French Hill
text: French Hill gets -3 shroud while there is any amount of doom on enemies at French Hill or treacheries attached to French Hill. [free] Place a doom on an enemy at French Hill or a treachery attached to French Hill. Forced - If there are no clues on French Hill: Flip it.

flavor: French Hill once again sits in its usual splendor, though its gambrel roofs rattle with the rumbling throughout the city.
name: French Hill

flavor: The woods outside of Arkham twist into strange shapes that you only recall from the much stranger Tulgey Wood.
name: Uptown
subname: Not Out of the Woods Yet
text: [action]: Search your deck or discard pile for a weakness and draw it. If you drew a weakness, discover 2 clues on Uptown (limit once per turn). Forced - If there are no clues on Uptown: Flip it.

flavor: Arkham's woods unravel and twist back into their familiar but foreboding forms, giving you little peace of mind.
name: Uptown

flavor: Southside's quiet roads are cluttered with silverware, crockery, and half-eaten refreshments from the Tea Party table.
name: Southside
text: [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Southside gets -3 shroud until the end of the phase. If you fail, take 1 horror (limit 1 success per round). Forced - If there are no clues on Southside: Flip it.

flavor: Southside once again sits in quiet seclusion, in stark contrast to the roiling chaos just north of it.
name: Southside

flavor: Despite its proximity to the breach between the two worlds, Easttown is relatively untouched by the chaos.
name: Easttown
text: Forced - After you fail a skill test by 2 or more at Easttown: Place 1 clue on Easttown from the token bank. [action]: Resign. There is no possible hope of repelling Gurathnaka, but there may still be a way to save yourself.
back_flavor: Easttown has always been considered one of the safer districts due to the police presence, but in these circumstances, it's just as vulnerable as the others.

flavor: If you can find the first cracks of Wonderland's incursion, then perhaps you might be able to seal it for good.
name: Downtown
text: Forced - After you resolve a test at Downtown where 3 or more skill icons were committed: Take 1 horror.
back_flavor: The region of Arkham where the trouble all began. It has mostly returned to an unaltered state, suprisingly.

flavor: Remnants of the earlier chaos still linger in Northside. They may be the key to fully closing off the connection to Wonderland.
name: Northside
text: Forced - After you resolve a test at Northside where 3 or more skill icons were committed: Take 1 damage.
back_flavor: When you left Northside behind in your journey to Wonderland, you weren't sure if you'd ever see it in a recognizable state ever again.

flavor: It will take all of your faculties to seal this rift between worlds and save Arkham from certain annihilation.
name: Vacuous Void
text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Vacuous Void: Discover an additional clue.
back_flavor: A wide tear in reality hovers far above the city. Wind rushes in toward it, but only the invading shadows seem to be affected by its pull.

name: Gurathnaka
text:
Massive.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text: Massive. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

name: Gurathnaka
text:
Massive. Retaliate.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text: Massive. Retaliate. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.
