text:
Massive. Retaliate.
<Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text: Massive. Retaliate. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

name: Gurathnaka
text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

name: Gurathnaka
text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

name: Insatiable Shade
text:
Hunter. Alert.
Insatiable Shade's damage and horror values are 1 less than Gurathnaka's damage and horror values.

name: Limits of Control
text: Revelation - For each weakness in Alice's hand, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to her. For each copy of Shadow Strain in Alice's hand, deal 1 additional horror to her. If there are no weaknesses in Alice's hand, Limits of Control gains surge.

name: Living Eclipse
text:
Massive.
Living Eclipse's location gets +2 shroud. Each location connected to Living Eclipse's location gets +1 shroud.

name: Mental Exhaustion
text: Revelation - Put Mental Exhaustion into play next to the agenda deck. Investigators (including Alice) cannot draw cards during upkeep. As an additional cost to take the draw action, take 1 horror. Forced - At the end of the round, discard 1 copy of Mental Exhaustion. (Max once per round)

name: Shadowy Gorger
text: Aloof. Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Shadowy Gorger is ready and unengaged: Place 1 doom on it.

name: Shattering Psyche
text: Revelation - Put Shattering Psyche into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an investigator discovers 2 or more total clues or places 2 or more total clues on an enemy during his or her turn: Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice. Forced - At the end of the round, discard a copy of Shattering Psyche. (Max once per round)

name: Spatial Stutter
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve the following (choose one): - Move to a connecting location and take 2 damage. - Move to a location exactly 2 connections away from your location and take 1 damage. Then, if there are more clues on your new location than on your previous location: Take 1 horror.

name: Weakening Boundary
text: Revelation - Attach Weakening Boundary to the location with the most clues. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase: Place 1 clue (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 players) on the attached location (from the token bank) or place 1 doom on Weakening Boundary (choose one). If it is act 2, you cannot choose to place clues. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Weakening Boundary. Forced - If Weakening Boundary's location is flipped, discard Weakening Boundary.

name: Tenebrous Nightmares
text: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Nightmares into play in your threat area. You cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase. [action][action]: Discard Tenebrous Nightmare.

flavor: "Curiouser and curiouser."
name: Alice Liddell
text:
[reaction] When an investigator at Alice's location would test with any skill: Use Alice's base [intellect] for that skill instead (limit once for each investigator per round).
[elder_sign] +0. Choose and shuffle a card from your discard pile back into your deck. Any investigator at Alice's location may use this effect instead of their own elder sign effect.
back_text: Deck Size: 24. Deckbuilding Options: Follow the Alice's Assistance section in the campaign guide to construct Alice's deck. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): All cards included are determined by the investigator's choices. Additional Restrictions: Cannot be used by players.
back_flavor: The investigators have traversed Wonderland and returned to Arkham to find Alice still at the center of the chaos.  Can the investigators help separate Wonderland from Arkham before Gurathnaka can secure itself in reality?  Will Alice even be able to withstand the strain of her dreams bridging dimensions?

name: Alice's Courage
text: Put Alice's Courage into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator engages or becomes engaged with an enemy: That investigator may draw a card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Courage.

name: Alice's Compassion
text: Put Alice's Compassion into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator heals any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator heals 1 additional damage or horror (choose one). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Compassion.

name: Alice's Patience
text: Put Alice's Patience into play next to Alice. [reaction] After an investigator resolves a test where he or she committed a skill card to that test: That investigator may draw a card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Patience.

name: Alice's Curiosity
text: Put Alice's Curiosity into play next to Alice. [reaction] After an investigator moves: That investigator gets +1 on all skill tests until the end of his or her turn (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Curiosity.

name: Alice's Intuition
text: Put Alice's Intuition into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator would play an event: That event gains fast (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Intuition.

name: Alice's Reason
text: Put Alice's Reason into play next to Alice. [free] An investigator performing a test gets +X to that test, where X is the amount of clues he or she controls (max +4, limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Reason.

name: Lack of Courage
text: Put Lack of Courage into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator engages or becomes engaged with an enemy: That investigator discards a card from his or her hand at random. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Courage.

name: Lack of Compassion
text: Put Lack of Compassion into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator heals any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator heals 1 less damage and/or horror. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Compassion.

name: Lack of Patience
text: Put Lack of Patience into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator is performing a test: That investigator must commit a skill card to that test if possible. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Patience.

name: Lack of Curiosity
text: Put Lack of Curiosity into play next to Alice. Forced - After an investigator moves: That investigator gets -1 on all skill tests until the end of his or her turn. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Curiosity.

name: Lack of Intuition
text: Put Lack of Intuition into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator would play an event: That investigator must spend 2 additional resources. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Intuition.

name: Lack of Reason
text: Put Lack of Reason into play next to Alice. Forced - The first test each investigator performs gets -X, where X is the amount of clues he or she controls (max -4). At the end of the round, discard Lack of Reason.

flavor: The White Rabbit leaps past you, tapping his pocket watch frantically. "There are still seconds to spare! Use them quickly!"
name: Still Ticking
text: Put Still Ticking into play next to Alice. Move all doom from all enemies and treacheries in play to Still Ticking. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Still Ticking.

flavor: A broken pocket watch lies on the ground in front of you, stuck just one minute to twelve o'clock.
name: Running Out of Time
text: Put Running Out of Time into play next to Alice. Forced - After an investigator fails a test against an enemy: Place 1 doom on that enemy (limit once per investigator turn). At the end of the round, discard Running Out of Time.

flavor: The Walrus and the Carpenter are suddenly walking beside you, providing many insights that are strangely useful.
name: Talk of Many Things
text: Put Talk of Many Things into play next to Alice. Each investigator other than Alice may immediately draw up to 3 cards. Investigators may choose not to discard cards during the upkeep phase. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Talk of Many Things.

flavor: But answer came there none —
name: Shed a Bitter Tear
text: Put Shed a Bitter Tear into play next to Alice. Forced - As an additional cost to play an asset or event, an investigator must discard another card from his or her hand. At the end of the round, discard Shed a Bitter Tear.

flavor: "More tea?" The Hatter and the March Hare reach from above and below you, offering refreshments.
name: The Best Butter
text: Put The Best Butter into play next to Alice. [free] During an investigator's turn, that investigator may play an asset from his or her hand, paying half its cost, rounded up (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard The Best Butter.

flavor: Cups and saucers fly, hurled at the shadows by the sole remaining occupant of the tea party table.
name: Wasn't Very Civil
text: Put Wasn't Very Civil into play next to Alice. [free] During an investigator's turn, that investigator may play an asset from his or her hand, paying its cost (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Wasn't Very Civil.

flavor: A cracked tea set sits on the ground before you, smeared with butter, jam, and blood.
name: Empty Table
text: Put Empty Table into play next to Alice. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator discards an asset he or she controls or discards two assets from his or her hand (choose one). Then, discard Empty Table.

flavor: The Queen of Hearts is suddenly beside you, flanked by dozens of card guards and still bearing a grudge against the shadows.
name: The Queen's Justice
text: Put The Queen's Justice into play next to Alice. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase: Deal 1 damage to each enemy in play. For each enemy defeated by this effect, each investigator other than Alice may gain 1 resource. At the end of the round, discard The Queen's Justice.

flavor: You happen across an enormous pool of blood with the Queen of Hearts' crown half-sunken into it.
name: Broke Her Crown
text: Put Broke Her Crown into play next to Alice. Forced - When an enemy would enter the encounter discard pile or victory display: Place that enemy back on top of the encounter deck instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Broke Her Crown.

flavor: Astonishingly, the Snark stands before you once again, ready to assist you with its many talents.
name: Qualities of a Snark
text: Put Qualities of a Snark into play next to Alice. Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators… - …commanded the Snark,all investigators get +1 [willpower]. - …puzzled the Snark,all investigators get +1 [intellect]. - …intimidated the Snark,all investigators get +1 [combat]. - …tricked the Snark,all investigators get +1 [agility]. - …intrigued the Snark,all investigators get +1 to all skills. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Qualities of a Snark.

flavor: "But if ever I meet with a Boojum, that day, In a moment (of this I am sure), I shall softly and suddenly vanish away— And the notion I cannot endure!"
name: Softly and Suddenly Vanished
text: Put Softly and Suddenly Vanished into play next to Alice. Forced - After an [[Ally]] asset controlled by an investigator takes any amount of damage or horror: Defeat that [[Ally]] asset. At the end of the round, discard Softly and Suddenly Vanished.

flavor: "O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!" He chortled in his joy.
name: Galumphing Back
text: Put Galumphing Back into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator would take any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator takes 1 fewer damage or horror (choose one). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Galumphing Back.

flavor: "Beware the Jabberwock, my son! The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!"
name: Jaws That Bite
text: Put Jaws That Bite into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator would take any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator takes 1 additional damage or horror (choose one). At the end of the round, discard Jaws That Bite.

flavor: Tweedledum and Tweedledee stand shoulder to shoulder, ready to assist in their own meager way.
name: Brothers in Arms
text: Put Brothers in Arms into play next to Alice. [reaction] When a card would enter an investigator's discard pile: That investigator may place it on top of his or her deck instead (Limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Brothers in Arms.

flavor: The living Tweedle focuses his grief and anger at the shadows that indirectly caused him to lose his brother.
name: Sole Survivor
text: Put Sole Survivor into play next to Alice. [reaction] When a card would enter an investigator's discard pile: That investigator may shuffle it into their deck instead (Limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Sole Survivor.

flavor: Cracked pots, dented washtubs, and shredded pillows lie in a heap, each piece speckled with blood.
name: No Survivors
text: Put No Survivors into play next to Alice. Forced - When a non-weakness card would enter an investigator's discard pile: Remove that card from the game instead. At the end of the round, discard No Survivors.

flavor: The White King appears, commanding an army of chess pieces that obey his every whim.
name: Royal Decree
text: Put Royal Decree into play next to Alice. Each investigator other than Alice may gain up to 4 resources. Playing assets or events does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Royal Decree.

flavor: "For the want of a battle the kingdom was lost…"
name: For Want of a Nail
text: Put For Want of a Nail into play next to Alice. Investigators cannot activate [free] or [reaction] abilities, or play events with the fast keyword. Forced - At the end of the round, discard For Want of a Nail.

flavor: With a victorious cheer, the White Knight gallops onto the field of battle, barely keeping his place in the saddle.
name: Glory and Honor
text: Put Glory and Honor into play next to Alice. All abilities on treachery and weakness cards require one fewer action to activate. If an ability on a treachery or weakness only requires one action, it can be activated as a [free] instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Glory and Honor.

flavor: You find a shattered sword lying on the ground, alongside several dented pieces of armor.
name: The Better Part of Valor
text: Put The Better Part of Valor into play next to Alice. All abilities on treachery and weakness cards require an additional action to activate. Forced - At the end of the round, discard The Better Part of Valor.

name: Shadow Strain
text: Put Shadow Strain into play next to Alice. Set Alice's base [intellect] to 1. Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice (choose one) and discard Shadow Strain.

flavor: "You must be," said the Cat, "or you wouldn't have come here."
name: The Cheshire Cat
text: Permanent. [reaction] When you would fail a skill test by exactly 1: You automatically succeed instead. Flip The Cheshire Cat. Forced - When the player controlling The Cheshire Cat would be defeated or would resign: Choose another player. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat.

flavor: "If you don't know where you want to go, then it doesn't matter which path you take."
name: The Cheshire Cat
text: Permanent. Forced - When you would succeed a skill test by exactly 1: You automatically fail instead. Flip The Cheshire Cat. Forced - When the player controlling The Cheshire Cat would be defeated or would resign: Choose another player. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat.

name: Nonsensical Advice
text: Surge. Revelation - Shuffle any amount of cards from your hand back into your deck and draw an equal amount of cards. For each card you did not shuffle back into your deck, lose 1 resource.

flavor: "I'd rather not," the Cat remarked.
name: Petulant Creature
text: Surge. Revelation - Flip The Cheshire Cat.

name: Vanished Away
text: Surge. Peril. Revelation - Choose a player who does not currently control The Cheshire Cat. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat. If there is only one active player, ignore this revelation effect.

name: Card Guard (Clubs)
text: Forced - After Card Guard (Clubs) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [combat] icon. If you cannot, take 1 horror.

name: Card Guard (Diamonds)
text: Forced - After Card Guard (Diamonds) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [agility] icon. If you cannot, take 1 damage.

name: Card Guard (Hearts)
text: Forced - After Card Guard (Hearts) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [willpower] icon. If you cannot, take 1 damage.

name: Card Guard (Spades)
text: Forced - After Card Guard (Spades) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [intellect] icon. If you cannot, take 1 horror.

name: Misdeal
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (1). This test's difficulty increases by 1 for every 2 [[Card]] enemies in the encounter discard pile. If you fail, discard 2 cards from your hand at random. Then, if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, take 1 damage.

name: Weak Hand
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if there is a [[Card]] enemy at your location. For each point you fail by, take 1 horror or choose and discard a card from your hand.

name: Red Pawn
text: The first Red Pawn drawn each mythos phase gains surge.

name: Red Knight
text: Hunter. Forced - After Red Knight attacks you: Lose 1 resource (2 resources instead if Red Knight moved to your location before attacking).

name: Red Bishop
text:
Alert.
Each other [[Chess]] enemy at this location gains Alert.

name: Red Rook
text:
Retaliate.
Each other [[Chess]] enemy at this location gains Retaliate.

name: Exchange Sacrifice
text: Revelation - Put Exchange Sacrifice into play next to the agenda. Forced - After a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated or discarded: The investigator that defeated or discarded that enemy takes 1 damage or loses 2 resources. Then, discard Exchange Sacrifice.

name: Threatened Position
text: Revelation - Put Threatened Position into play in your threat area. While there is a [[Chess]] enemy at your location, you get -2 to all skills during skill tests except during fight or evade attempts. [action] [action]: Discard Threatened Position.

name: Animated Shadow
text: X is equal to the engaged investigator's base [combat]. Animated Shadow cannot make attacks of opportunity or be engaged by other investigators. Forced - If Animated Shadow is evaded, defeat it. If the investigator engaged with Animated Shadow is defeated or resigns, discard Animated Shadow.

name: Deepening Dusk
text: Revelation - Attach to your location. The attached location gets +1 shroud. [[Shadow]] enemies at the attached location get +1 fight and +1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Deepening Dusk.

name: Edge of Your Vision
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is equal to your location's shroud value. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile and deck for a [[Shadow]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you. If you searched the encounter deck, shuffle it. Then, take 1 horror for each [[Shadow]] enemy at your location.

name: Haunting Shade
text:
Hunter. Aloof.
Haunting Shade's location gets +2 shroud. If there are no clues on its location, Haunting Shade loses aloof and gets +1 fight and +1 damage.

flavor: In any other realm, you would want to succeed.
name: Backward Logic
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (5). Treat "-" modifiers on revealed tokens as "+", and "+" modifiers on revealed tokens as "-". Icons committed to this test subtract from your total instead of add to it. If you succeed, lose 1 action. If you succeeded by 2 or more, take 1 horror. If you fail, nothing happens.

name: Brain Teaser
text: Revelation - Put Brain Teaser into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When doom would be placed on any other card (including the agenda): Place 1 doom on Brain Teaser (limit once per phase). [action]: Test [intellect] (4). This test gets -1 difficulty for each doom on Brain Teaser. If you succeed, discard Brain Teaser.

name: Questioning the Answer
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If there are no clues on your location, cards cannot be committed to this test. If you fail, take 1 horror and discard 1 card from your hand at random.

name: Strange Challenge
text: Revelation - Test any skill (4). If you fail, take 2 damage and put Strange Challenge into play in your threat area. Set the base value of the earlier chosen skill to 1. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Strange Challenge.

name: Cognitive Dissonance
text: Revelation - If you do not control any clues, Cognitive Dissonance gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue you control (max +3). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location. If you fail by 2 or more, lose 1 action.

name: Curiouser and Curiouser
text: Revelation - Put Curiouser and Curiouser into play in your threat area. Forced - As an additional cost to investigate, if there are more clues on any other location than on your location: Take 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Curiouser and Curiouser.

name: Disjunction
text: Revelation - Discard any number of cards from your hand or from play whose total cost is equal to or greater than your location's shroud value. If you cannot, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

name: Impossible Paths
text: Revelation - Attach Impossible Paths to your location. Forced - When you would take an action to move from the attached location: Test [agility] (0). This test's difficulty increases by 1 for each location connected to your location. If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. [action] [action]: Discard Impossible Paths.

text: Surge. Revelation - Put The Dodo into play next to the agenda deck. [reaction] When a [skull] token is revealed: Cancel that token. Do not reveal another token. Discard The Dodo.

text: Surge. Revelation - Put The Lion and the Unicorn into play next to the agenda deck. [reaction] After an enemy is defeated or discarded: Each investigator may heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Discard The Lion and the Unicorn.

flavor: "Curiouser and curiouser."
name: Alice Liddell
text:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would test with any skill: Use your base [intellect] for that skill instead (limit once for each investigator per round).
[elder_sign] +0. Choose and shuffle a card from your discard pile back into your deck. Any investigator at your location may use this effect instead of their own elder sign effect.
back_flavor: It was often said that Alice lived in her own little world. Alice had to agree of course, as she had been there several times before. She knew that Wonderland was a dream, but it all seemed as real to her as her native England. This belief attracted the attention of a shadowy being named Gurathnaka who saw opportunity in Alice's dreams. As Alice grew, it tried to solidify her belief in Wonderland until it began to merge with the real world. Alice attempted to outrun the spreading chaos, until her journeys brought her to Arkham, Massachusetts where a group of investigators freed her mind from Gurathnaka's influence. Alice has vowed to repay their deeds by helping to solve as many of Arkham's bizarre happenings as she can.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards with "uses (secrets)" level 0-2, up to five other level 0 Mystic and/or Survivor cards ([mystic] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mysteries of Wonderland, Lost in Thought, 1 random basic weakness.

flavor: "And how do you know that you're mad?"
name: Mysteries of Wonderland
text:
Alice Liddell deck only.
[reaction] After you spend a secret from an asset you control: Draw a card or heal 1 horror (choose one, limit once per round).
[free] During a skill test you are performing, take 1 horror and exhaust Mysteries of Wonderland: You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the highest number of secrets on an asset you control (max +4).

name: Lost in Thought
text: Uses (0 secrets). If there are 4 or more secrets on Lost in Thought, discard it. Revelation - Put Lost in Thought into play in your threat area. Set your base [intellect] to X, where X is the number of secrets on Lost in Thought. Ignore any other game effect that would change your base [intellect]. [free] Move 1 secret from an asset you control to Lost in Thought. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Lost in Thought from the token bank, as a secret.
